availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Enoch Orestus Prince (Caldwell County, Kentucky, farmer and private 3rd KY Mtd Inf (C.S.A.))

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Enoch B. Prince and Alvey H. Stevens Prince. Married to Martha Ann Satterfield Prince in Princeton, Kentucky, in June 1859. Father of Margaret Prince. Resident of Caldwell County in 1850. Farmer in Caldwell County in 1860. Enlisted in the 3rd Kentucky Mounted Infantry Regiment (C.S.A.) as a private on November 17, 1861. Detailed at Camp Smith’s Ferry on the Pearl River, Mississippi, in October 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 2, p. 378A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, p. 34.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, p. 496B.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records – Microfilm (1852-1910), KDLA, Roll #994029, Caldwell County Marriages, p. 507.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Caldwell County Marriages, Film #007719555.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky: Confederate Kentucky Volunteers War 1861-65, vol. 1 (Frankfort: Legislature of Kentucky, 1915), 100.
Compiled Service Records of Confederate Soldiers who Served in Organizations from the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 109, Microfilm Series M319, Roll 0066.
